TopicTitle: Can we get some advanced post editing tools?

Articles.Content:
Obviously you can bold, italics, create urls, etc. your text on the forum by typing it out, but I'd really like to see buttons for this stuff. It's a simple suggestion, but I'm guessing it'd take a little bit of working to do. How likely is this to happen?

*Edit: Okay, well apparently my forum layout isn't the same. Mine looks like below. It's been that way since I joined the forums 3 years ago, on 2 different computers over the years. What's going* 

***Edit 2: Got it fixed, thanks for the help everyone. I came here hoping for the forum to get an update and found out it already existed. That's great!***

Are you sure you're not in WYSIWYG mode? (the ^A^*/**A* button at the top left of the editor).
Yeah, that's WYSIWYG (What You See Is What You Get) mode. You can enable it for Quick Reply boxes too, depending on your profile setting. I rather like it, but it has one or two irksome bugs.
Also, even in source mode (which I use exclusively) you can highlight text and hit - for example - ctrl-i to italicize.

(Well, I thought I turned it off... it appears to be persistent! DIE!!!)

I get a bug with pasting a lot. When I paste, especially in my company thread OP, afterwords it teleports me to a random place in the post. (its really long thanks to spoilers)

Also, just tried the WYSIWYG mode, first stroke of "backspace" and it teleported 3 spaces back XD

The teleporting cursor is usually the result of how it handles the formatting. Using backspace or arrow keys to move the cursor often causes it to reset the cursor to the endpoint of the last formatting change. No idea why, though.
